notes: Lab experiment studying betrayal aversion across six countries. Subjects play trust games under three game types (DP=dictator-principal, RDG=risky dictator game, TG=trust game). Main claim: minimum acceptable probability (MAP) differs across game types, indicating betrayal aversion. Table 2 OLS regressions are the main regression-based analysis. Table 1 uses rank-sum tests (non-parametric). Data is individual-level from lab sessions.

design_audit.notes: Three game types (DP, RDG, TG) randomly assigned within sessions. Baseline OLS: map ~ tg + dp, clustered by session. RDG is omitted category. Sample restricted to movers (mover==1).

claim_object.outcome_concept: Minimum acceptable probability (MAP) in a trust/dictator game
claim_object.treatment_concept: Game type: Trust Game (TG) vs Risky Dictator Game (RDG) vs Dictator-Principal (DP)
claim_object.estimand_concept: ITT effect of game type assignment on MAP, indicating betrayal aversion (TG coefficient) and strategic uncertainty aversion (DP coefficient)
claim_object.target_population: Lab experiment participants across 6 countries (Brazil, China, Oman, Switzerland, Turkey, US)

baseline_specs.label: Table2-Col1
baseline_specs.notes: reg map tg dp if mover==1, cl(session). Focal coefficient is on tg (betrayal aversion). No controls.

baseline_specs.label: Table2-Col2
baseline_specs.notes: Same regression with demographic and country controls added.

baseline_specs.label: Table2-Col3
baseline_specs.notes: Col2 plus gender and Oman interactions with treatment.

constraints.notes: Baseline is no controls (Col1). Max is 14 controls (Col3 with interactions). All regressions include both tg and dp as treatment indicators with RDG as omitted category.

canonical.notes: Clustered SEs at session level, matching the paper's baseline cl(session).

budgets.notes: Moderate budget. Controls pool is small (9 non-interaction controls + 5 interactions). Country-level sample restrictions add ~6 specs per subsample variant.

sampling.notes: 9 optional non-interaction controls organized into 2 blocks (demographics: female/age/income/econmajor; country dummies: brazil/china/oman/swiss/turk). Exhaustive block combos plus random variable-level subsets.

diagnostics_plan.notes: Balance check: test whether demographics/country differ across game types.
